beer.beer_description:
A Beer To Make The Gravy

Inspired by Paul Kelly's anthem and brewed for those drivin' down from Queensland, or flyin' in from the coast. The perfect mate for your roast of choice whether you're sweating it out in the kitchen or outside setting up the stumps. Flour, salt - a little red wine & tomato sauce for the extra tang. Don't forget the dash of beer - a dash for you and a dash for the gravy. Stir until thick. Pour over everything.

items.checkin_comment: Rosemary. savoury. Would be a great base for a meat pie!

user.bio: Travelling the world one beer at a time!

items.badge_description: Feel the burn! No, not from your pre-beer work out, but from the spiced beverage you are now partaking of. That's 5 different beers with the style of Spiced / Herbed Beer, Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale, or Chilli / Chile Beer. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: Carwyn Canvent 2025 #21. Bit too herby but according to the description it’s meant to be used to make gravy, not to drink. Bad luck I didn’t need gravy on 21st Dec…

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!
